candidates.title: Send owned span data to exporters
candidates.body:
As most exporters copy the majority of the exported span data, switch API to send owned data to exporters.

The export method now becomes:

```diff
- async fn export(&self, batch: &[Arc<trace::SpanData>]) -> trace::ExportResult
+ async fn export(&self, batch: Vec<trace::SpanData>) -> trace::ExportResult 
```

Additional small tweaks / bug fixes encountered during the refactor:

* Add missing `tokio` feature to async example's jaeger dependency
* Switch to custom `TBufferChannel` impl in jaeger exporter because the default buffer size is fixed and unknown at compile time.
* add trace_state impl to otlp exporter
* Expose dropped count on `EvictedQueue` and add to otlp exporter

candidates.title: Allow users to choose http client in zipkin and datadog exporter
candidates.body:
Reqwest is built on tokio. Without tokio, it will just not work. So move to isahc so that we could run in sync, tokio, and other async runtime.

Fixes #248

candidates.title: Update tonic feature and example dependencies
Trace module exports
candidates.body:
Resolves #254 Resolves #249 

* Moves trace exports from `api` and `sdk` to `api::trace` and `sdk::trace`
* Removes `metrics` from the default features

candidates.title: Switch to async exporters
candidates.body:
This change updates the `SpanExporter interface to export asynchronously. The primary API change is:

```diff
- fn export(&self, batch: Vec<Arc<trace::SpanData>>) -> trace::ExportResult;
+ async fn export(&self, batch: &[Arc<trace::SpanData>]) -> trace::ExportResult;
```

Implementation notes:

* Switch from `Vec<_>` to `&[_]` in exporters to avoid additional allocation when batch exporting.
* Currently uses [async_trait](https://github.com/dtolnay/async-trait), could change method signature to avoid the dependency if preferable.
* `BatchSpanProcessorWorker`'s `Future` impl now awaits sub-futures so replaced with async block for greater clarity.
* The [thrift](https://docs.rs/thrift) ~~and [grpcio](https://docs.rs/grpcio)~~ crates are not currently async, so some work still necessary to make jaeger and otlp exporters async (they currently call blocking code in a future, which is not great)

candidates.title: Pipeline builder for stdout trace exporter
candidates.body:
Part of #156

Implement the pipeline builder API for the stdout trace exporter, similar to the other exporters. With this a stdout trace pipeline can now be installed like this:

```rust
let tracer = opentelemetry::exporter::trace::stdout::new_pipeline().install();
```

I made 2 small changes along the way, which seemed to make sense to me. Happy to change in either direction, though. These are:

- Defer requirement of all additional writer traits to the `PipelineBuilder::install` function. Before `Debug` was required for the builder and `Send + 'static` were required only for the exporter. Now the builder is happy with only `Write` and requires `Debug + Send + 'static` for installation. I think I don't see any downsides here. We could also require all of these traits for the builder already. Not sure what's better.

- Defer wrapping writer in Mutex to when the exporter is created, which seems to be the point at which it's needed. Does this have any downsides?

Additional note:

This makes the pipeline the only way to construct a stdout exporter. This is in line with other exporters, but I'm not sure it's desired. Should we make `Exporter::new` public, so users can still create an exporter and setup a pipeline manually?

Update: `Exporter::new` is now public.

candidates.title: Add datadog exporter
candidates.body:
Closes #216 

Unfortunately this turned into a bit of a treasure hunt as the Datadog docs aren't particularly helpful, and Datadog has a slightly different design to OpenTelemetry requiring some fudgery. I've tried to document and provide links to where I sourced information from.

This implementation also uses the v0.5 trace ingestion API included in the latest datadog release. I hadn't realised quite how recent the API change was until I had already written most of the code, but the v0.3 is significantly simpler and so could be fairly easily added in future if there is demand for it.

To implement this exporter I made two changes to the actual OpenTelemetry "core"

- Add the ability to get values from EvictedHashMap by key
- Expose the InstrumentationLibrary in SpanData, the Golang OpenTelemetry implementation already does this so hopefully this isn't too controversial - see [here](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-go/blob/a12224a454135a5d7ec17831b6b39cf9723c0cdb/sdk/export/trace/trace.go#L79)

candidates.title: DDSketch
candidates.body: Probably need to add more comments or include some of my notes on algorithm and Go implementation. But want to open this PR to make sure I am in right track.

candidates.title: Add TraceState to SpanContext
candidates.body:
Resolves #211 

Adds `TraceState` to `SpanContext` and gives `TraceState` new methods per [spec](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/master/specification/trace/api.md#tracestate).

candidates.title: Update zipkin to use pipeline builder
candidates.body: Match Jaeger and OTLP builder styles

candidates.title: Add otlp exporter pipeline
Example usage of AWS X-Ray propagator
candidates.body: Example usage of AWS X-Ray propagator and ID generator. Mostly copied from `example/http`, includes print out of generated `x-amzn-trace-id`.

candidates.title: Switch to pipeline configuration for Jaeger exporter
Add Jaeger propagator
candidates.body: See [specification change](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/pull/770)

candidates.title: Semantic conventions crate
candidates.body:
This adds a new crate `opentelemetry-semantic-conventions`, which contains constants for the attributes defined in:

- https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/tree/master/specification/resource/semantic_conventions
- https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/tree/master/specification/trace/semantic_conventions

In order to add `const` `Key`s, this also adds a new function `from_static_str` to the `Key` implementation in the main crate.

Closes #162

candidates.title: Update OTLP exporter metadata
candidates.body: Fix invalid crate metadata (max 5 keywords) and add placeholder README

candidates.title: OTLP Trace Exporter
candidates.body:
Part of #161 - This PR does not yet cover metrics exporting or exporting via protocols other than `gRPC`. Still need to figure out how to set up integration tests for this. Wanted to get 👀  on the trace exporter before moving on to the metrics since it's already a huge diff and should probably wait until #141 is merged before trying to implement a metrics exporter.

## Summary of Changes

* Creates new `opentelemetry-otlp` crate
* Create `SpanExporter` for exporting traces via OTLP spec


### Testing

Tested using the `basic-otlp` example sending data to an [otel-collector OTLP receiver](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector/tree/master/receiver/otlpreceiver) and exporting to Jaeger

![Screen Shot 2020-08-10 at 13 03 43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3298522/89813704-1797b780-db10-11ea-9945-308a83a63c98.png)

candidates.title: Implement full metrics API
candidates.body:
This updates the metrics API to the [latest specification](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/master/specification/metrics/api.md).

Closes #5, closes #17, closes #22, closes #24, fixes #135, fixes #136, resolves #171

candidates.title: Move experimental features to separate folder
candidates.body: See #133

candidates.title: Add example with tracing_opentelemetry and tonic
candidates.body:
This example shows a more advanced setup and integration with `tracing`.  I think this would be helpful to show a more realistic production environment.  
One concern I have is that the example Cargo.toml has to rely on the crates.io version of `opentelemetry`, because `tracing-opentelemetry` relies on that crates.io version as well.  Maybe this example should be in the `tracing-opentelemetry` repository, but I couldn't find that.

candidates.title: Adding Context implemenations for HeaderMap and MetadataMap
candidates.body:
To make it easier to use opentelemetry from `hyper` and `tonic`, I added implementations for api::context::propagation::Carrier for [HeaderMap](https://docs.rs/http/0.2.1/http/header/struct.HeaderMap.html) and [MetadataMap](https://docs.rs/tonic/0.2.1/tonic/metadata/struct.MetadataMap.html) under feature flags `http_context` and `tonic_context` respectively.  

`cargo test --all` passes, `cargo clippy --all` passes.  Output in Jaeger of grpc example is the same.  Output of `cargo bench`:

candidates.title: trim opentelemetry-jaeger transitive dependencies
candidates.body:
Removes `prometheus`, `protobuf`, etc from the transitive dependencies
of `opentelemetry-jaeger`.

candidates.title: Add Correlations API
Tracing via context
Update examples
candidates.body:
This improves the examples by:

* Clarifying dependencies by moving them into their own `Cargo.toml`
* Adding images that show the resulting span information in their respective processors
* Adding a `grpc` example using [tonic](https://github.com/hyperium/tonic)
* Renaming the `hyper` example to `http` and showing both client and server examples
* Adding a `zipkin` example

candidates.title: Add Resource API
candidates.body: Allow providers to be configured with information about the entity for which telemetry is recorded. See the [Resources Spec](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/bdf39cb935a6f48badc687daeb78a66dc352761f/specification/overview.md#resources) for more information.
